documents.document: "What do you suppose will satisfy the soul except to walk free and own no superior?" - Walt Whitman
"Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence." - Robert Frost
"Age is a very high price to pay for maturity." - Tom Stoppard
"Change your thoughts and you change your world." - Norman Vincent Peale
"He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all." - Miguel De Cervantes
"We make war that we may live in peace." - Aristotle
"Hatred is the madness of the heart." - Byron
"Nothing baffles the schemes of evil people so much as the calm composure of great souls." - Gabriel Mirabeau
"Because I remember, I despair. Because I remember, I have the duty to reject despair." - Elie Wiesel
"O wise man, wash your hands of that friend who associates with your enemies." - Sadi
"The block of granite which is an obstacle in the pathway of the weak becomes a stepping-stone in the pathway of the strong." - Carlyle
"Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults." - Antisthenes
"Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty." - Jefferson
"I was angry with my friend; I told my wrath, my wrath did end. I was angry with my foe; I told it not; my wrath did grow." - William Blake
"To be feared is to fear; no one has been able to strike terror into others and at the same time enjoy peace of mind himself." - Seneca
"Security isn't anything more than superstition. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." - Helen Keller
"Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all others." - Winston Churchill
"To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield." - Tennyson
"Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." - Albert Einstein
"Nothing happens by itself.. it all will come ur way, once u understand that u have 2 make it come ur way, by ur own exertions." - Ben Stein
"Find a purpose in life so big it will challenge every capacity to be at your best." - David O. McKay
"Find a purpose in life so big it will challenge every capacity to be at your best." - David O. McKay
"When 1 door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long @ d closed door that we do not C the 1 which has opened for us."
"Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength; loving someone deeply gives you courage." - Lao Tzu
"Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress." - Nicholas Murray Butler
"Creative minds have always been known to survive any kind of bad training." - Anna Freud
"Men for the sake of getting a living forget to live." - Margaret Fuller
"Patience is the companion of wisdom." - St. Augustine
"Rather fail with honor than succeed by fraud." - Sophocles
"Man is so made that whenever anything fires his soul, impossibilities vanish." - Jean de la Fontaine
"Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened." - Billy Graham
"You must do the thing you think you cannot do." - Eleanor Roosevelt
"The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up." - Mark Twain
"Progress, far from consisting in change, depends on retentiveness. Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it." - George
"There is no conversation more boring than the one where everybody agrees." - Michel de Montaigne
"One can acquire everything in solitude except character." - Stendhal
"Those who stand for nothing fall for anything." - Alexander Hamilton
"I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection." - Thomas Paine
"To have what we want, is riches, but to be able to do without, is power." - George MacDonald
"Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others, cannot keep it from themselves." - Sir James M. Barrie
"The greatest mistake a man can ever make is to be afraid of making one." - Elbert Hubbard
"Only fools and dead men don't change their minds. Fools won't and dead men can't." John H. Patterson
"It is preoccupation with possessions, more than anything else, that prevents us from living freely and nobly." - Bertrand Russell
"Certain springs are tapped only when we are alone." - Anne Morrow Lindbergh
"Reflect upon ur present blessings, of which every man has many - not on ur past misfortunes, of which all men have some." - Charles Dickens
"Not he who has much is rich, but he who gives much." - Erich Fromm
"It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change." - Charles Darwin
"Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.' " - Lao Tzu
"The last of the human freedoms, to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, is to choose one's own way." - Viktor Frankl
"Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; great minds rise above them." - Washington Irving
"Take time 2 deliberate; but when d time 4 action arrives, stop thinking & go in. 1 man with courage makes a majority" - Andrew Jackson
"It is good to vary in order that you may frustrate the curious, especially those who envy you." - Baltasar Gracian
"He who controls the past commands the future. He who commands the future conquers the past." - George Orwell
"The trouble with the world is that the stupid are cocksure and the intelligent are full of doubt." - Bertrand Russell
"It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer." - Albert Einstein
"Consideration for others is the basis of a good life, a good society." - Confucius
"Failure is an event, never a person." - William D. Brown
"People in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than governments." - Dwight D. Eisenhower
"To keep ur marriage brimming, / With love in the loving cup, / Whenever u r wrong, admit it; / Whenever u r right, shut up." - Ogden Nash
"The moment the slave resolves that he will no longer B a slave, his fetters fall ... Freedom & slavery R mental states." - Mohandas Gandhi
"Things may come to those who wait ... but only the things left by those who hustle." - Abraham Lincoln
"Be willing to launch in faith, with no guarantees of success. This is the mark of personal greatness." - Brian Tracy
"Go often to the house of a friend, for weeds choke the unused path." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"Fear not, the people may be deluded for a moment, but cannot be corrupted." - Andrew Jackson
"Liberty may be endangered by the abuses of liberty as well as by the abuses of power." - James Madison
"Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable." - Sydney J. Harris
"If u would b a real seeker after truth, its necessary that @least 1ce in ur life u doubt, as far as possible, all things." - Rene Descartes
"The important thing is not to stop questioning." - Albert Einstein
"For all sad words of tongue or pen, The saddest are these: It might have been." - John Greenleaf Whittier
"Growth begins when we begin to accept our own weakness." - Jean Vanier
"Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. " - Leonardo da Vinci
"A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions." - Marcus Aurelius
"A man should always consider ... how much more unhappy he might be than he is." - Joseph Addison
"Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks on great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself." - Cicero
"Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing." - Albert Schweitzer
"It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong." - Voltaire
"In order to become the master, the politician poses as the servant." - Charles De Gaulle
"It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." - Aristotle
"Time is the coin of life. Only you can determine how it will be spent." - Carl Sandburg
"Man's main task in life is to give birth to himself, to become what he potentially is." - Erich Fromm
"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." - Benjamin Franklin
"An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come." - Victor Hugo
"Ability may take you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there." - John Wooden
"The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." - William Arthur Ward
"You can accomplish much if you don't care who gets the credit." - Ronald Reagan
"Freedom is man's capacity to take a hand in his own development. It is our capacity to mold ourselves." - Rollo May
"Function in disaster. Finish in style." - Lucy Madeira
"Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance." - Samuel Johnson
"It is never too late to be what you might have been." - George Eliot
"As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live." - Goethe
"A pessimist is 1 who makes difficulties of his opportunities & an optimist is 1 who makes opportunities of his difficulties." -Harry Truman
"It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer." - Albert Einstein
"I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen." - Ernest Hemingway
"First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do." - Epictetus
"Our patience will achieve more than our force." - Edmund Burke
"Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it." - Lou Holtz
"It is the nature of man to rise to greatness if greatness is expected of him." - John Steinbeck
"We can often do more for other men by trying to correct our own faults than by trying to correct theirs." - Francois Fenelon
"He who has a why to live can bear with almost any how." - Viktor Frankl
"There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered." - Nelson Mandela
